channel.title: mathling tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from mathling.

item.description:
Something obvious from my experience (re)confirmed by a bit of research and already the reply guys are doling out the vicious denials

sigh

Best part of being retired is getting away from that $!*+ https://t.co/riQ8qyZU0r

item.description:
We need a new word for the amount of sheer obliviousness and chutzpah required for a company to send a sales rep along 2 hrs after tech arrives to fix outage already 5 days old, 4 hrs (2 calls) on the phone old, 4 hrs waiting through expected arrival time old

GTFOðŸ˜¡

item.description: @LifesABeach6786 @VeryBadLlama Size 12 as well. Was told by Nordstrom salesman, and I quote: "There are no feet that size!"
item.source:markdown: @LifesABeach6786 @VeryBadLlama Size 12 as well. Was told by Nordstrom salesman, and I quote: "There are no feet that size!"

item.description:
It is truly gobsmacking that a man whose whole job is PR, who has been trained to do this PR job for decades & decades, who has been waiting & expecting to be given this PR job his whole life, is nevertheless astonishingly appallingly shockingly bad at PR

Love to see it
item.source:markdown:
It is truly gobsmacking that a man whose whole job is PR, who has been trained to do this PR job for decades & decades, who has been waiting & expecting to be given this PR job his whole life, is nevertheless astonishingly appallingly shockingly bad at PR
Love to see it

item.description:
Folks, it is hotter than Hades own butt-cheeks out there

Expecting deliveries? Someone toting boxes in the noonday glare? See that mail carrier toiling in their open-sided un-ACed van through the heat of the day? Who else?

Remember what mama taught you, golden rule

Be kind https://t.co/Zoprd4TGlO
item.source:markdown:
Folks, it is hotter than Hades own butt-cheeks out there
Expecting deliveries? Someone toting boxes in the noonday glare? See that mail carrier toiling in their open-sided un-ACed van through the heat of the day? Who else?
Remember what mama taught you, golden rule
Be kind https://t.co/Zoprd4TGlO

item.title: GenerativeArt interlude
item.description:
Your friend, the polynomial spiral

#XQuery #SVG https://t.co/tIiyx4r22x

Wrought + verdigris https://t.co/N5L8CHJaCT

The brass shield https://t.co/ELMkdPrhC7

All these are created by rotating a random polynomial spiral around the central point. Depending on the order of the polynomial and the range of parametric values plotted, you get more or less intricate designs.

Fraying on the edges https://t.co/ivpkvAsu05

Last one, although I could generate these all day and love every single one

Sometimes the simplest systems give the best results

Lace https://t.co/b8S1ziOWya
item.source:markdown:
Your friend, the polynomial spiral
#XQuery #SVG https://t.co/tIiyx4r22x
Wrought + verdigris https://t.co/N5L8CHJaCT
The brass shield https://t.co/ELMkdPrhC7
All these are created by rotating a random polynomial spiral around the central point. Depending on the order of the polynomial and the range of parametric values plotted, you get more or less intricate designs.
Fraying on the edges https://t.co/ivpkvAsu05
Last one, although I could generate these all day and love every single one
Sometimes the simplest systems give the best results
Lace https://t.co/b8S1ziOWya

item.title: GenerativeArt interlude
item.description:
Experiments with mutated dense flows

The predatory tunicate

#SVG #XQuery https://t.co/tIzVF6cQTf

The smoke plume

Although the dominant impression is of streamers rising from the bottom, this is backwards. See the looped structure at the top (a random polynomial spiral, in fact)? The streamers all start there and converge at the bottom. https://t.co/tXIF4cjc6K

Sea butterfly

The basic flow is built using a billow fractal noise field over a dense set of points along a starting curve or in a starting region. Then I maybe apply a mutation function to remap all the points (here: "crumple") https://t.co/hiT8RqwAuQ
item.source:markdown:
Experiments with mutated dense flows
The predatory tunicate
#SVG #XQuery https://t.co/tIzVF6cQTf
The smoke plume
Although the dominant impression is of streamers rising from the bottom, this is backwards. See the looped structure at the top (a random polynomial spiral, in fact)? The streamers all *start* there and converge at the bottom. https://t.co/tXIF4cjc6K
Sea butterfly
The basic flow is built using a billow fractal noise field over a dense set of points along a starting curve or in a starting region. Then I maybe apply a mutation function to remap all the points (here: "crumple") https://t.co/hiT8RqwAuQ

item.title: GenerativeArt interlude
item.description:
Hex Katakamuna

Because why do something on a rectangular grid when you can do it on a hex grid?

#XQuery #SVG https://t.co/BTWV3TNJXl

That said, the hex layout looks messier I tried to make the same kinds of symbols, but some of them have odd asymmetries https://t.co/AzIC6cdS86
item.source:markdown:
Hex Katakamuna
Because why do something on a rectangular grid when you can do it on a hex grid?

That said, the hex layout looks messier I tried to make the same kinds of symbols, but some of them have odd asymmetries https://t.co/AzIC6cdS86
